Indeed, official guidelines or laws usually have to prove that increased restrictions have clear benefit. Usually this means setting isolation days at the median or below the median, not N sigma above.

But those with privilege to stay home should go above the minimum guidelines or law!!

talk.author: did:plc:7vqvkvmpekx77t7wyeam4yqz
talk.utter:
It is hard to (legally) defend a policy that says 10-14 days isolation if the majority of infected people will not be contagious at that point.

It also depends on which school(s) of thought one adopts in regards to how much influence public health should have on people's lives and choices.

talk.author: did:plc:7vqvkvmpekx77t7wyeam4yqz
talk.utter:
I will refrain from my own opinion because of job. But I think a lot of posts re: public health is ignoring the science is due to a mismatch of that public health org's goals and the poster's goals. 

In that case, more effective to lobby for different goals than to cite papers.

talk.author: did:plc:62gdkmpwa7xme36getyqnem3
talk.utter: I think a big part of the problem is people not understanding the motivation behind the public health guidelines. Unfortunately a lot of people see a general guideline meant to be a good balance between public health & societal function & take it as applying specifically to their individual case.
